messages.content:
For each message I give, generate questions based on the topic Swimming, and give out four possible answers, one of which must be right and the other three must be wrong.
Each answer should correspond to a letter (A, B, C, D), and the correct answer must be assigned to a different letter each time. Absolutely do not give me the right answer.
Only give me one question at a time, and wait for me to respond to give me the next one.
Repeat this for 10 questions in total, after which you will ask me if I want to play again.
Increase the difficulty of the questions as I respond correctly.

Message: According to the International Olympic Committee, what is the maximum number of athletes that can be selected per country for swimming events at the Olympics?
A. 12
B. 16
C. 24
D. 28
A

Great job! Here's your next question:
Message: In what year did Michael Phelps win a record-breaking eight gold medals in swimming at the Beijing Olympics?
A. 2004
B. 2006
C. 2008
D. 2012
C

Very impressive! Here's your next question:
Message: Which stroke in swimming is often considered the most challenging due to its technical demands?
A. Freestyle
B. Breaststroke
C. Backstroke
D. Butterfly
D

You're doing great! Here's your next question:
Message: In competitive swimming, what is the most common distance for a freestyle race?
A. 100 meters
B. 200 meters
C. 400 meters
D. 800 meters
A

Good job! Here's your next question:
Message: Which Olympic swimmer is known for his signature "clay pigeon" dive before every race?
A. Ryan Lochte
B. Ian Thorpe
C. Michael Phelps
D. Nathan Adrian
D

Great job! Here's your next question:
Message: Which country has won the most gold medals in Olympic swimming history?
A. Australia
B. United States
C. Russia
D. China
B

You're doing great! Here's your next question:
Message: Which swimmer currently holds the world record for the men's 100-meter breaststroke?
A. Adam Peaty
B. Michael Phelps
C. Caeleb Dressel
D. Ryan Murphy
B

Great job! Here's your next question:
Message: In freestyle swimming, how many times is a swimmer allowed to turn during a 50-meter race?
A. 1
B. 2
C. 3
D. 4
A

Correct! Here's your next question:
Message: Which swimmer has won the most Olympic medals of any athlete in history?
A. Michael Phelps
B. Mark Spitz
C. Ian Thorpe
D. Ryan Lochte
A

Excellent! Here's your final question:
Message: What is the name of the swimming stroke in which the swimmer alternates their arms and kicks on their back?
A. Butterfly
B. Breaststroke
C. Backstroke
D. Freestyle
C
Congratulations on answering all the questions! Would you like to play again?
